citation:Description.dsDescription:Text: We conducted a cross-sectional quantitative analysis to examine the impact of selective database searching on results of meta-analyses. Our sample included systematic reviews with at least one meta-analysis from three Cochrane Review Groups.

citation:Contact.datasetContact:Name: Robin Featherstone
citation:Contact.datasetContact:Affiliation: Alberta Research Centre for Health Evidence (ARCHE)

citation:Distributor.distributor:Name: Alberta Research Centre for Health Evidence (ARCHE)

Related Publication.Citation: Hartling L, Featherstone RM, Nuspl M, Shave K, Dryden D, & Vandermeer B. (2016). The contribution of databases to the results of systematic reviews: a cross-sectional study. BMC Medical Research Methodology. [In review].

ore:describes.Title: The contribution of databases to the results of systematic reviews: a cross-sectional study
ore:describes.schema:name: The contribution of databases to the results of systematic reviews: a cross-sectional study
ore:describes.dvcore:termsOfUse: Permission from the Alberta Research Centre for Health Evidence (ARCHE) is required to download data files for this project. Attribution is required for use of the data with the statement: The authors acknowledge the Alberta Research Centre (ARCHE) at the University of Alberta for collecting and sharing the data analyzed for this work.

ore:aggregates.schema:description: Presence of trials in databases contributing to Cochrane meta-analyses for the Acute Respiratory Infections (ARI) review group.
ore:aggregates.schema:name: ARI_DBs.xlsx

ore:aggregates.schema:description: Presence of trials in databases contributing to Cochrane meta-analyses for the Developmental Psychosocial and Learning Problems (DPLP) review group.
